cold_snaps.status: No active cold snap is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Today's storm ranked 8th for total rainfall with 13.04mm having fallen, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  8.6mm per hour fell at points during the storm which lasted 7.9 hours.  27.64mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 15.9 hour precipitation event.  At times precipitation was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate climaxed at 27.0mm per hour today (ranking first from our records), resulting in 7.99mm of total rain in 2.0 hours.

storm.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 23 November 2024, the storm lasted 23.2 hours with a total precipitation of 24.56mm reaching 6.4mm per hour at times.
Active storm detected in the vicinity.  The last storm we experienced was on 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 26 August 2025, is ranked 5th among the longest rainy periods since August 2024.  It has lasted 9 days consecutively so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (207°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 78.44 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 4.0°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1658 m) and inside temperature (up 2.2°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 70.5m lower than yesterday, 554.7m lower than the past week, 1658.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 713m and a high of 1594m, averaging 996.5m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, oppressively muggy and sticky and very little to no wind will be present. Rain showers likely, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and a mix of sun and clouds. Changeable conditions.
